title: European Communities Act 2007 (No. 18 of 2007)) and for the purpose of giving
heading: 1. (1) These Regulations may be cited as the European Communities
text_raw:
1. (1) These Regulations may be cited as the European Communities 
(Carriage of Dangerous Goods by Road and Use of Transportable Pressure 
Equipment) (Amendment) Regulations 2025. 

(2) The European Communities (Carriage of Dangerous Goods by Road 
and Use of Transportable Pressure Equipment) Regulations 2011 to 2023 and 
these Regulations may be cited together as the European Communities 
(Carriage of Dangerous Goods by Road and Use of Transportable Pressure 
Equipment) Regulations 2011 to 2025. 

(3) In these Regulations “Principal Regulations” means the European 
Communities (Carriage of Dangerous Goods by Road and Use of 
Transportable Pressure Equipment) Regulations 2011 (S.I. No. 349 of 2011).

title: European Communities Act 2007 (No. 18 of 2007)) and for the purpose of giving
heading: 3. Regulation 5(4) of the Principal Regulations, as amended by the
text_raw:
3. Regulation 5(4) of the Principal Regulations, as amended by the 
European Communities (Carriage of Dangerous Goods by Road and Use of 
Transportable Pressure Equipment) (Amendment) Regulations 2013, is 
amended by substituting for subparagraph (a) the following: 

“A competent authority may following notification to the Minister, exceptionally 
and provided that safety is not compromised, issue individual national 
authorisations in accordance with Article 6(5) of the Directive to carry out 
transport operations of dangerous goods within the State which are prohibited 
by the Directive or to carry out such operations under conditions different from 
those laid down in the Directive provided that those transport operations are 
clearly defined and limited in time.”.

heading: 4. Regulation 10(1)(g) of the Principal Regulations is amended by
text_raw:
4. Regulation 10(1)(g) of the Principal Regulations is amended by 

inserting after clause (v) the following clauses: 

“(vi) the granting and issue of national authorisations pursuant to Regulation 
5(4)(a), 

(vii) the granting and issue of competent authority approvals and recognitions as 
required by the ADR, 

(viii) in agreement with competent authorities of other contracting parties, to 
authorise certain transport operations by temporary derogation from the 
requirements of the ADR in accordance with Chapter 1.5.1 of the ADR.”.

text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation.) 

These Regulations transpose the provisions of Commission Delegated Directive 
(EU) 2025/149 of 15 November 2024 amending the Annexes to Directive 
2008/68/EC of the European Parliament and of the Council on the inland 
transport of dangerous goods to take into account scientific and technical 
progress (insofar as that Directive relates to the transport of dangerous goods by 
road) to give effect to the provisions of the ADR applicable from 1 January 2025. 
The Regulations give further effect to Directive 2008/68/EC of the European 
Parliament and of the Council of 24 September 2008 as amended by Commission 
Implementing Decision (EU) 2024/1762 of 5 June 2024, to authorise certain 
national derogations. 

The Regulations also gives further effect to the provisions of Directive (EU) 
2022/1999 on uniform procedures for checks on the transport of dangerous 
goods by road as amended by Decision (EU) 2024/1254 of the European 
Parliament and of the Council of 24 April 2024. 

These Regulations amend the European Communities (Carriage of Dangerous 
Goods by Road and Use of Transportable Pressure Equipment) Regulations 2011 
(S.I. No. 349 of 2011) and can be cited together with all previous amending 
statutory instruments as the European Communities (Carriage of Dangerous 
Goods by Road and Use of Transportable Pressure Equipment) (Amendment) 
Regulations 2011 to 2025.
